availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dennis Mulligan (Fayette County, Kentucky, tavern keeper, grocer, and liquor dealer)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, tavern keeper, grocer, and liquor dealer. Native of Ireland. Married to Ellen A. McCoy Mulligan in Fayette County, Kentucky, in November 843. Father of James Mulligan. Tavern keeper in Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Lexington in 1850. Grocer in Lexington in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860. Liquor dealer in Lexington in 1862. Liquor dealer in Lexington in 1863. Tavern keeper in Fayette County in 1864. Grocer in Lexington in 1864. Liquor dealer in Lexington in 1865.
